name: Nano Spiculum Hammer
description:
The Nano Spiculum Hammer is used to make smaller spiculums than the Micro Spiculum Hammer.  Can be used with 26 ga to 30 ga metal. 

Head length is the same length as Micro Spiculum but half as wide.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

For use with the Purple Heart Micro Spiculum Block and Micro Spiculum Closing Hammer to produce the tiniest spiculums of all shapes.

hammer and handle length:240mm l
head: 80mm l X 9mm w X 10mm h
faces: 4mm w X .8mm h, 4mm w X 1.5mm h
weight: 22 grams

name: The Angelina
description:
The Angelina Hammer - Long, Lean Sophistication!  Angelina is perfect when you need a longer reach than Little Alice can provide.
5 inch long head with faces that are 1/2" by 1/4" and 1/2" by 1/8".  Made for shell forming.

name: Bad Betty Spiculum Hammer
description:
Named for Betty Helen Longhi, the Bad Betty Spiculum Hammer is the perfect hammer for all your large spiculum-making needs.  The elongated curved shape of the hammer head allows you to work at the perfect angle for forming your metal into spiculums of all shapes!  

For use with the Bad Betty Spiculum Block and the Large Closing Hammer.

Machined from Billet Steel with traditional Hickory handles.

name: Super Cindy Spiculum Hammer
description:
The Super Cindy Spiculum Hammer is the perfect hammer for all your medium to large spiculum-making needs. The elongated curved shape of the hammer head allows you to work at the perfect angle for forming your metal into spiculums of all shapes!
 
For use with the Bad Betty Spiculum Block and the Large Closing Hammer.
 
Machined from Billet Steel with traditional Hickory handles.

name: Macro Spiculum Hammer
description:
The Macro Spiculum Hammer is used to make small to medium sized spiculums from 24 ga to 30 metal. For use with the Purple Heart Macro Spiculum Block and Large Closing Hammer to produce small spiculums of all shapes.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

hammer and handle length:240mm l
head: 130mm l X 14mm w X 12mm h
faces: 9mm l X21mm w, 10mm l X 4mm w
weight: 22 grams

name: Micro Spiculum Hammer
description:
The Micro Spiculum Hammer is used to make small to micro sized spiculums from 24 ga to 30 metal. 

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

For use with the Purple Heart Micro Spiculum Block and Micro Spiculum Closing Hammer to produce tiny spiculums of all shapes.

hammer and handle length:240mm l
head: 80mm l X 9mm w X 10mm h
faces: 7mm l X 1mm w, 8mm l X 2mm w
weight: 22 grams

name: Large Closing Hammer
description:
NC BLACK developed a Larger Closing Hammer perfectly sized and balanced to easily close medium to large sized spiculums without deforming them. 

This hammer also makes an excellent planishing hammer for micro sized voluminous pieces.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

name: Long Closing Hammer - 4 inch
description:
NC BLACK developed a Long Closing Hammer perfectly sized and balanced to easily close spiculums of various sizes without deforming them. 

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

name: Micro Closing Hammer
description:
NC BLACK developed a Micro Closing Hammer perfectly sized and balanced to easily close micro sized spiculums without deforming them. 

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.
 
hammer and handle length: 228mm l
head: 76mm l X 9mm dia
faces: 9mm dia
weight: 30 grams

name: Large Spiculum Block
description:
The Large Spiculum Block is used with the Bad Betty Spiculum Hammer and Large Closing Hammer to make larger spiculums from 20 to 24 ga metal.
 
Made of hard Maple, the grooves cut into the sides are designed to help you produce spiculums of all shapes!

name: Purple Heart Macro Spiculum Block
description:
The Macro Spiculum Block is used with the Macro Spiculum Hammer and Micro Closing Hammer to make small to small spiculums from 24 ga to 30 metal.
 
Made of hard Purple Heart wood, the grooves cut into the sides are designed to help you produce small spiculums of all shapes!

name: Purple Heart Micro Spiculum Block
description:
The Micro Spiculum Block is used with the Micro Spiculum Hammer and Micro Closing Hammer to make small to micro sized spiculums from 24 ga to 30 metal.

Made of hard Purple Heart wood, the troughs cut into the sides are designed to help you produce tiny spiculums of all shapes!

name: C Hammer
description:
The C Hammer has excellent breadth and mass for moving metal that is 20 ga to 24 ga. It is an ideal hammer for pushing metal using Micro Synclastic forming techniques. 

Machined from Billet Steel with traditional Hickory handles.

hammer and handle length:300mm l
head: 75mm l X 20mm w X 15mm h
faces: 20mm l X 14mm w, 19mm l X 8mm 
weight 140 grams

name: Mini C Hammer
description:
The Mini C Hammer is the middle sized hammer, between the K Hammer and C Hammer, for Micro Synclastic Raising. This hammer is ideal for shaping metal that is 22 ga to 28 ga using traditional techniques on the micro scale.

Machined from Billet Steel with traditional Hickory handles.

hammer and handle length:270mm l
head: 65mm l X 17mm w X 14mm h
faces: 17mm l X 9mm w, 15mm l X 6mm w
weight 68 grams

name: K Hammer
description:
The K Hammer has been developed by NC BLACK as the superlative Micro Synclastic and Micro Shell Forming hammer. It has ideal proportion and weight distribution for Micro Shell Forming 24 ga to 30 ga metals. Use the K Hammer to maneuver thin metal and create a wide assortment of traditional shell forms.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

hammer and handle length: 240mm 
head: 45mm l X 9mm w X 10mm h 
faces: 8mm l X 7mm w, 5mm l X 5mm w 
weight: 15 grams

name: J Hammer
description:
The J Hammer has been developed by NC BLACK as an even smaller version of the K Hammer. It has ideal proportion and weight distribution for Micro Shell Forming 26 ga to 30 ga metals. Use the J Hammer to maneuver thin metal and create a wide assortment of traditional shell forms.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

hammer and handle length: 240mm 
head: 45mm l X 9mm w X 10mm h 
faces: 7.5mm l X 6mm w, 6.5mm l X 5mm w 
weight: 15 grams

name: Purple Heart Bracelet Block
description:
The Purple Heart Bracelet Block is ideal for forming and fabrication of micro sized anticlastic bracelets.  It is intended for long term use with the C, Mini C, K and Macro Spiculum Hammers. 

Use the NC Black Bracelet Block Holder to securely hold the block in your vise without annoying slippage as you work!  (Bracelet Block Holder sold separately.)

name: Purple Heart Necklace Block
description:
The Purple Heart Necklace Block is ideal for forming and fabrication of anticlastic neck forms. 

Use the NC Black Necklace Block Holder to securely hold the block in your vise without annoying slippage as you work! (Necklace Block Holder sold separately.)

name: Bracelet Block Holder
description: Use the Bracelet Block Holder to securely hold your bracelet block in the vise to prevent annoying slippage as you work.  Machined from high grade aluminum, the bracelet block holder is desinged specifically for holding the NC Black Co. Purple Heart Bracelet Block, and may not work with other forming blocks. (Purple Heart Bracelet Block sold separately.)

name: Necklace Block Holder
description:
Use the Necklace Block Holder to securely hold your necklace block in the vise to prevent annoying slippage as you work. 

Machined from high grade aluminum, the bracelet block holder is desinged specifically for holding the NC Black Co. Purple Heart Necklace Block, and may not work with other forming blocks. (Purple Heart Necklace Block sold separately.)

name: Little Annie Forming Hammer
description:
This hammer is perfect for all types of small shell forming.  The elongated head allows for a long reach into a piece while maintaining excellent weight and balance. The faces for this hammer are very curved.

Machined from Billet Steel with traditional Hickory handle.

name: Little Alice Hammer
description:
Little Alice is a very versatile little hammer.  It is designed to be the perfect size and weight for various micro shell-forming projects.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

name: Reggie Hammer
description:
The Reggie Hammer is the perfect hammer for using Micro Shell Forming techniques on 24 to 30 gauge metal.

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

.

name: Mega Nylon Mallet
description:
The Mega Mallet is an optimum weight for medium to large work. In addition to its superb balance, its material makes this a versatile mallet. Nylon is preferred over Delrin as it allows just enough 'bounce' to each blow. This allows better hammer lift for the user in all synclastic and anticlastic techniques.

Machined from 6/6 Nylon with traditional American-made Hickory handle.

hammer and handle length: 310 mm l
head: 145mm l X 38mm dia
faces: 38mm l X 5mm w, 38mm dia
weight: 300gm

name: Small Nylon Mallet
description:
The Small Nylon Mallet is an optimum weight for small work. In addition to its superb balance, its material make this a versatile mallet. Nylon is preferred over Delrin as it allows just enough 'bounce' to each blow. This allows better hammer lift for the user in all synclastic and anticlastic techniques. 

Machined from 6/6 Nylon with traditional Hickory handle.

hammer and handle length: 310 mm l
head: 145mm l X 25mm dia
faces: 25mm l X 2mm w, 25mm dia
weight: 200 grams

name: Micro Nylon Mallet
description:
The Micro Nylon Mallet is specially designed for use with the Micro Sinusoidal Stake in anticlastic raising. Its size and weight dispersion are ideal for micro shell forming and micro anticlastic raising. Nylon is preferred over Delrin as it allows just enough 'bounce' to each blow. This allows better hammer lift for the user in all synclastic and anticlastic techniques. 

Machined from 6/6 Nylon with traditional Hickory handle.

hammer and handle length: 255mm l
head: 140mm l X 19mm dia
faces: 19mm l X 2mm w, 19mm dia
weight: 100 grams

name: Nano Nylon Mallet
description:
The Nano Nylon Mallet is the smallest nylon mallet available. It is designed to reach the tightest and tiniest areas in any piece. It can be used with the Micro Sinusoidal Stake in anticlastic raising. Nylon is preferred over Delrin as it allows just enough 'bounce' to each blow. This allows better hammer lift for the user in all synclastic and anticlastic techniques. 

hammer and handle length: 235mm l
head: 145mm l X 12mm dia
faces: 12mm l X .05mm w, 12mm dia
weight: 50 grams

name: End Hook Stakes
description:
NC Black End Hook Stakes are the perfect tools for Anticlastic Forming and Raising.  Can't take the plunge of buying Sinusoidal Stakes right now?  The bays of the End Hook Stakes replicate the bays of traditional Sinusoidal Stakes from small to micro scale.  

Available sizes:
3/4", 11/16", 5/8", 9/16", 1/2", 7/16", 3/8", 5/16", 1/4", 3/16", and 1/8" diameters.

The Entire End Hook Stake Set is available at a discounted rate.  Buy them all, and receive 12% off!

Recommended for use with NC Black Nylon Mallets and NC Black Stake Holders. (Sold separately.)

name: Large Stake Holder
description:
This stake holder is designed to clamp your stake in place in your vise to prevent annoying slippage as you hammer.  The screws rest of top of your vise jaws, while the clamping action keeps the sides in place.  Jaws can be turned to adjust for varying stake sizes. This holder works for stakes 7/16" to 3/4" in diameter.

Fabricated from aluminum with steel screws.  

These Micro Forming Stakes are recommended for use ONLY with NC BLACK Co.'s Micro Forming Stakes! Other manufacturer's tools MAY NOT operate properly with these items as they were specifically designed and manufactured to work with NC BLACK Co.'s Tools.

name: Small Stake Holder
description:
This stake holder is designed to clamp your stake in place in your vise to prevent annoying slippage as you hammer.  The screws rest of top of your vise jaws, while the clamping action keeps the sides in place.  Jaws can be turned to adjust for varying stake sizes. This holder works for stakes 1/8" to 3/8" in diameter.

Fabricated from aluminum with steel screws.  

These Micro Forming Stakes are recommended for use ONLY with NC BLACK Co.'s Micro Forming Stakes! Other manufacturer's tools MAY NOT operate properly with these items as they were specifically designed and manufactured to work with NC BLACK Co.'s Tools.

name: Hardwood Sinking Block
description:
This sinking block is hand-turned from hardwood.  It is ideal for forming small and micro sized bowl shapes.

Recommended for use with the NC Black Lignum Sinking Mallet.

name: Annie Raising Hammer
description:
While working with the Little Annie Forming Hammer one day, we decided that with a little face altering, it would be quite a sweet micro raising hammer... thus the Annie Raising Hammer was born!

With excellent weight and balance, this hammer features faces with a little less curvature than its shell forming counterpart, making it ideal for raising tiny vessels of all shapes. The faces on this hammer are only slightly curved compared to the Little Annie Forming Hammer.

Machined from Billet Steel with traditional Hickory handle.

For use with NC Black Micro Raising Stakes (sold separately).

name: Green Micarta Raising Mallet
description:
This is an excellent Raising Mallet for beginners as well as experienced metalsmiths who want to raise on the micro scale.  

Micarta is a resin-based material known for its durability, which is what enables it to be such a fantastic tool for raising metal.  

The Micarta Raising Mallet is the ideal size and weight for raising thinner gauge metal, such as 20-22g.  The thinner end of the mallet is used for raising, while the fatter end is ideal for bouging.

Machined from Micarta laminate with traditional American-made Hickory handle.

name: Micro Raising Stakes
description:
NC Black designed these Raising Stakes specifically for metalsmiths who want to raise thinner gauge material on a micro scale.  The faces feature a slightly flattened top and a rounded nose for ease in raising.

Machined from AAA Grade Billet Tool Steel.

Available sizes: 1/2" and 5/8" diameters.

Recommended for use with the NC Black Raising Stake Holder.

name: Micro Raising Stake Holder
description:
This stake holder is designed to clamp your Raising Stake in place in your vise to prevent annoying slippage as you raise. The screws rest of top of your vise jaws, while the clamping action keeps the sides in place. The stake slot is at a 45 angle, making it an ideal holder for NC Black Micro Raising Stakes (sold separately).

Fabricated from aluminum with steel screws.
 
These Micro Raising Stake Holders are recommended for use ONLY with NC BLACK Co.'s Micro Raising Stakes! Other manufacturer's tools MAY NOT operate properly with these items as they were specifically designed and manufactured to work with NC BLACK Co.'s Tools.

name: Large Engraving Hammer
description:
This hammer is perfectly balanced for Hand and Hammer Engraving. The larger size is perfect for Hammer Engravers that have a light touch. 

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

name: Small Engraving Hammer
description:
This hammer is perfectly balanced for Hand and Hammer Engraving. The smaller size is perfect for Hammer Engravers that have a heavier touch. 

Machined from Billet Steel with hand turned Purple Heart handles.

name: Purple Heart Engraving Mallet
description:
This mallet is perfectly balanced for the Beginner Hand and Hammer Engraver. The lighter weight and size is ideal for Student Hammer Engravers that have a very heavy hammer technique. 

Completely hand turned from Purple Heart.
